page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW -RAFFORD AREA
page.content: The area we visited lies on high ground to the South East of Forres,a town near the Moray Firth in the North East of Scotland. The land is almost entirely rural with forests or farmland being the dominant feature.The farmland is a mixture of cultivated grassland and crops.The main crop is barley which is used for malt in the whisky industry. Apart from isolated farms the nly house in the area lie in upper and lower Rafford.There is a mixture of old properties and new bungalows.The only large mansion in the area is Blervie House , a large Georgian style house with its own grounds. Most people apart from farmers commute to Forres,Elgin or Kinloss where there is a large NATO airbase.There are few amenities in the area.
